alert.note: Alert for Golden Valley; Judith Gap; Melville Foothills; Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Northern Park; Northern Stillwater; Northern Sweet Grass; Southern Wheatland; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 15 at 1:41PM MST until January 18 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills occurring. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Montana. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday night through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Wind chills may cause exposed skin to become quickly frostbitten or frozen through Tuesday morning. Regarding the winter storm watch, roads will likely become snowpacked, slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: During the wind chill advisory, people are urged to stay indoors until conditions improve. If you must go outside, dress in layers. Several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Cover exposed skin to reduce your risk of frostbite or hypothermia. People may want to delay all travel if possible during the winter storm watch period. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution and be prepared for sudden changes in visibility. Keep track of the latest forecast updates.
